title: Álvaro Peña (Bolivian footballer)
text:
Álvaro Guillermo Peña Peña (born 11 February 1965) is a Bolivian <a href="association%20football">football</a> manager and player who played as a <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>.
Playing career.
Club.
At club level he played for <a href="Club%20San%20Jos%C3%A9">San José</a>, where he was the Bolivian league topscorer in 1992. He played abroad with <a href="Deportes%20Temuco">Deportes Temuco</a> of <a href="Chile">Chile</a> between 1993 and 1994 and for <a href="Cortulu%C3%A1">Cortuluá</a> of <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a> in 1995.
His other clubs in Bolivia include <a href="Club%20Blooming">Blooming</a>, <a href="Oriente%20Petrolero">Oriente Petrolero</a>, <a href="Club%20Bol%C3%ADvar">Bolívar</a>, <a href="Club%20Destroyers">Destroyers</a>, <a href="The%20Strongest">The Strongest</a> and <a href="Mariscal%20Braun">Mariscal Braun</a>.
International.
He played 43 international matches and scored 4 goals for the <a href="Bolivia%20national%20football%20team">Bolivia national team</a> He made one appearance in the <a href="1994%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1994 FIFA World Cup</a> and represented his country in 2 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches.
Managerial career.
After retiring as a player, Peña took up coaching. He has served as the manager for Blooming, Oriente Petrolero and Destroyers. He is currently under contract with Ukrainian team <a href="FC%20Dynamo%20Kyiv">Dinamo Kiev</a>, where he is part of the youth sector's coaching staff.
Personal life.
His younger brother <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Pe%C3%B1a%20%28Bolivian%20manager%29">José</a> is also a football manager.
